A boat is a watercraft of a large range of type and size. Ships are generally distinguished from boats based on their larger size, shape, and cargo or passenger capacity, and their ability to carry boats.
Gasoline is a clear petroleum-derived flammable liquid that is used primarily as a fuel in internal combustion engines.
Gasoline is a fuel made from crude oil and other petroleum liquids.

A boat is a watercraft of a large range of sizes designed to float, plane, work or travel on water. Small boats are typically found on inland waterways such as rivers and lakes, or in protected coastal areas.
Gasoline is a transparent, petroleum-derived liquid that is used primarily as a fuel in spark-ignited internal combustion engines.
